intro: Odontites discolor var. longistylus, commonly known as the long-styled toothed buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, toothed leaves and yellow flowers with long, slender stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it is often found in open meadows and rocky slopes. The variety longistylus is distinguished by its elongated stamens, which are a key feature in its botanical identification.
